Event.name: Verdict
Event.definition:
<def-root>In this frame, which is a part of the Trial sequence, a <fen>Judge</fen> gives a <fen>Finding</fen> with respect to the <fen>Charges</fen> against the <fen>Defendant</fen> in a particular <fen>Case</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Defendant">He</fex> was <t>convicted</t> <fex name="Charges">of fraud</fex> <fex name="Judge">by Judge Judy</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Judge
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Judge</fen> (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the <fen>Finding</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Finding
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the outcome of the <fen>Judge</fen>'s deliberation or consideration. Many LUs in this frame incorporate this FE. </def-root>

Arg.name: Defendant
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person who stands accused of a crime and is subject to the verdict.</def-root>

Arg.name: Charges
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE refers to the <fen>Charges</fen> with respect to which the verdict is being given.</def-root>

Arg.name: Case
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Case</fen> on which the verdict is being given. </def-root>

Arg.name: Legal_basis
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the basis in law of a verdict. <ex>He was found <t>guilty</t> <fex name="LBasis">under section 28 article 5</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the verdict was reached. <ex>He was <t>convicted</t> <fex name="cir">on a four to three vote</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Judge</fen> acts. </def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Judge</fen> returns a particular verdict. <ex>Did you <t>acquit</t> him <fex name="Purp">just to get the publicity</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies an action that the <fen>Judge</fen> performs in order to return the verdict.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> for the verdict given. <ex>The jury <t>convicted</t> him on all charges <fex name="exp">because of the overwhelming evidence against him</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: find.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a court) officially declare to be the case; (with against or for) make a decision against (or in favour of); judge to be guilty (or innocent).

lexUnit.name: finding.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a conclusion reached as a result of an inquiry, investigation or trial

lexUnit.name: ruling.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an authoritative decision or pronouncement

lexUnit.name: convict.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: declare to be guilty of a criminal offence by the verdict of a jury or the decision of a judge in a court of law.

lexUnit.name: conviction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the act or process of convicting someone; an instance of being convicted

lexUnit.name: acquit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: formally declare not guilty of a criminal charge

lexUnit.name: acquittal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a formal declaration that someone is not guilty of a criminal charge

lexUnit.name: verdict.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a decision on an issue of fact in a civil or criminal case or inquest

lexUnit.name: clear.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: show or declare officially to be innocent

lexUnit.name: guilty.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: culpable of a specified wrongdoing.

lexUnit.name: not guilty.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not culpable of a specified wrongdoing.
